pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:5.1: 47. The training rule on shaking the hands
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate shaking their hands. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:7.2: “‘I will not eat shaking the hands,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:8.1: One should not eat shaking the hands.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect eats shaking his hands, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:9.6: if he shakes the hand to discard rubbish;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:9.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:10.1: The seventh training rule is finished.
